channel.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
channel.description:
Why was there no thread about this yet? Or isn't France poor enough to feel sad about it?
Anyway, 52 deaths in France so far + a bunch more in the rest of continental Europe.
[url]https://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/europe/02/28/europe.storms/index.html[/url] (outdated newspost)

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: Acristoff
item.description:
Mont_Blanc:

I do but I don’t create threads about it.

I don’t either.

Read full topic
item.source: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
It seems northern Europe was hit by a colder winter this year and people don’t use to be as prepared as we are in mountain regions. I laugh when bystanders complain when the roads are covered by 2cm of snow . But I must admit it’s nothing compared to what happened in the north-east of the US last month.

Read full topic

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: X_Mastershot_X
item.description:
you are taking this too serious. 1 month ago it was like Cold Hell in Anatolia. We couldn’t even walk. But it’s over. There are more serious problems on the world. I’m not saying your problems are less. but look at the world. It isn’t having good times.

Read full topic

item.source: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Another reason that we don’t seem to care as much is because France does have the infrastructure in place to take care of its citizens, residents, and visiting aliens in times of crisis or catastrophe.

It’s that little thing that many seem to berate and attack: Government.

[COLOR=‘Black’]inb4 Reagan’s “9 Most Terrifying Words” quote

Read full topic

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Bolteh:

Why was there no thread about this yet? Or isn’t France poor enough to feel sad about it?

Anyway, 52 deaths in France so far + a bunch more in the rest of continental Europe.

https://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/europe/02/28/europe.storms/index.html (outdated newspost)

too bad you arent going to send money to help.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Mont_Blanc:

Thanks a lot (and very good French )

French is the only thing I still remember from high school, and it was only 1 year ago. :’(

Le français est la seule chose dont je me rappelle encore de l’école, meme si ça fait seulement 1 an que j’ai fini mes études. :’(

Read full topic

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Deleted posts were to save the rest of us from gauging our eyes out over the excelerated argument about why countries don’t get along. In short… derailed. And you got it back on the derailment. :meh:

Read full topic
item.source: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Deleted posts make me a sad panda. =( I don’t really think it was offensive enough to delete.

But I do believe it’s pretty arrogant, ignorant, and bitchy. We’re all human beings, I think we should all help our fellow people in need. I know I’d feel bad if, let’s say, North Korea initiated a purge in which no one was left alive.

Anyway, back to the topic at hand, I didn’t hear about it until now, actually. That sounds pretty bad, though. Whole world’s going to shit.

Read full topic
item.source: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
I think we were taken a bit by surprise, thinking it wouldn’t be as strong as this. But now it’s time to help them clean and rebuild, even if it’s not as dramatic as Haiti or Chile.

sersoft:

À tous ceux qui sont en France, je vous souhaite bonne chance et un rétablissement rapide.

Thanks a lot (and very good French )

JohnKiller118:

This is why:
https://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/8143780.stm
REVENGE!!! HAHAHAHA!!!

But seriously, this really is a tragedy.

Yup totally. No tips, no effort in foreign language and sometimes pain in the ass .

CTID:

I wouldn’t say the country of France itself, but dislike toward the US is pretty rampant beyond the people, calling us American Pigs and the like, until they need our help, then they are willing to kiss ass.

So when did my poeple asked for your help and where did you heard calling pigs and whatnot ?

Read full topic
item.source: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe

item.description:
lets not drail the thred by discussing the u.s. / france issues.

I am not surprised to hear of the storms across the pond tho. Our north east coast was hit hard recently.

Read full topic

item.title: Massive storm strikes France and other parts of Europe
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

It is bad all over I tell you. I hope the storms don’t go on too long. Seriously folks… care for your elderly and neighbors when weather gets tough.

These are wise words one should follow.
I definitely hope that they make a speedy recovery after these storms.

Read full topic
